implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. This is part of managing tasks, as it allows users to view the current list of tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives a TaskCreate object and delegates to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for adding a new task to the persistent storage. Ensures a unique ID is assigned and saves the task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create a new Task with a unique id and fields from TaskCreate
Append the new task to the list
Save all tasks to disk
Return the new task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated task data and delegates to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If no task is found, raise 404 error
    Return the updated task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles updating an existing task in persistent storage. Finds the task by ID and replaces it with the updated data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
For each task:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace the old task
        Save all tasks to disk
        Return updated task
If not found, return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Delegates deletion to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not found, raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles removing a task from persistent storage by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Filter out the task with the given id
If a task was removed:
    Save all tasks to disk
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

    category (Optional[Category])
    due_date (Optional[date])
    completed (bool, default False)
